body:
Ah, didn't know it was included in the Phar as the main installation method is Composer.
How can an extension accept configuration settings in a generic way from the phpunit.xml? Or should it create a separate file?
When the generic ways (constants, global variables) are not good enough then, I think, it would be best to go with a separate file.

issue.title: Selenium documentation doesn't mention ExitHandler.php though prepend includes it
Deprecated configuration setting "selenium" used
issue.body:
I am using the PHPUnit 4.7 documentation https://phpunit.de/manual/current/en/appendixes.configuration.html to configure browser in XML configuration file :  

``` xml
<selenium>                                                                                                                                  
   <browser name="Firefox"                                                                                                                   
                     browser="*firefox /usr/bin/firefox"                                                                                     
                     host="localhost"                                                                                                        
                     port="4444"                                                                                                             
                     timeout="30000"/>                                                                                                       
 </selenium>
```

The settings is throwing phpunit warning:

```
Warning:        Deprecated configuration setting "selenium" used
```

What should we use instead of the deprecated tag?

issue.title: Outsource PHPUnit_Selenium XML definitions
issue.body:
How can we bring this:
https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/3.6/PHPUnit/TextUI/Command.php#L663
into PHPUnit_Selenium? It would be more easy to extend as also Selenium2TestCase will need configuration.

issue.title: Selenium tests cannot generate code coverage for their current process
issue.body:
Due to this line in PHPUnit_Framework_TestResult:

```
--- a/PHPUnit/Framework/TestResult.php
+++ b/PHPUnit/Framework/TestResult.php
@@ -601,7 +601,6 @@ class PHPUnit_Framework_TestResult implements Countable

$useXdebug = self::$useXdebug &&
$this->codeCoverage !== NULL &&
-!$test instanceof PHPUnit_Extensions_SeleniumTestCase &&
!$test instanceof PHPUnit_Framework_Warning;
```

Selenium test cases cannot generate a code coverage for the code they execute in the current process. This would be useful for two reasons:
- Selenium tests can use a backdoor to manipulate the state of the application before accessing it via the browser, or to assert it afterwards. For example, they may set up a database table's content or checking the result of some query. This code coverage does not show up in the report.
- obtaining code coverage from the test suite of PHPUnit_Selenium.
  I don't know if just removing the line is the right solution, but works for me on PHPUnit_Selenium.

---

Edit by @edorian: Fixed the markdown

body: We use phpunit version 5.0 (phar) and in case when a test fails phpunit delivers a large stack trace and an error that a selenium class can not be found.
@naptoon Please open a new ticket for this with the complete stacktrace.
